text: No more flowers, just earth, wood and bones.
Corrupted and restored, the once-derelict Ogham Stones channel their considerable powers to serve your cause.

Nagashizzar, which means "Glory of Nagash" in High Nehekharan, known also as the Cursed Pit.
The Warpstone mines beneath Nagashizzar form a huge honeycomb of galleries and mineshafts, patrolled by untiring sentries from Nagash's Undead legions.
Four mighty gates guard the approaches to Nagashizzar, made from a nameless black metal which shines like burning obsidian and is ten times harder than steel.

Within his audience chamber at the height of the peak Nagash sits on his throne of skulls. He has brooded here for over a millennium, waiting and planning, guiding his agents by the power of his thoughts.
Nagashizzar the Black City, is one of the mightiest fortresses the world has ever seen, excavated from the living rock of Cripple Peak.
The once great city has been left completely in ruins, a shell of its former glory.

The Hall of Rebirth that surrounds the palace’s grand royal gardens, creates an illusion of tamed wilderness and beauty, brilliantly coloured songbirds fill the space with serenity discretely hiding a chilling laughter of cruelty.

Queen Neferata rules over her Lahmina sisterhood from here, enacting out her plots and machinations from finding lost items, devotees amongst the nobility, deluded pawns and lovers who can be used to rebuild Lahmia.

The Temple of Blood is a fortress within a fortress. Situated within the walls of the Lahmian royal palace. Its single entrance sealed with a pair of immense bronze doors and guards the home of The Cult of Blood.
The City of the Dawn home to the first of the Vampires, restored through blood to be a beacon of lethal beauty.
A colossal black tower of carved obsidian pierces through the landscape with a shrouded dark aura puzzling at its base.
The ground has split in two, a chilling wind gushes into the chasm, ferrying a stream of souls to its depths.
Legions of ancient warriors encased behind grand carved stones, waiting to hear their call to battle.
Underneath these sandstone tombs lay the vast dorment armies of Nehekhara.
Glory of Nagash, forever and always.
Hear the siren's call, as the dead are calling.
No pulse, no breath, no life, yet still they stir.
Warpstone is Nagash's most valuable resource and he will strip the earth bare to get it all.
Unstable footing accompanied by a mysterious crunching sound...
There are some places in the world where no living thing should tread.
Obscured behind chocking mists, a vast grasping bog that saps the energy for all who venture through it.
Dont get too close now, you might just lose your soul.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Many a rider has lost their steed in the treacherous drifting sands. The corpses still litter the fast-holding mires.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Countless soldiers have fallen in battle. In the wake of Nagash, they will all rise to fight again.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Next to every great temple of the Mortuary Cult lies a covered pit in which its deadly, ophic guardians dwell.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Great beasts of burden and horrors of the desert, broken and made to serve their Undead masters.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The crack of cartilage, the snap, the whine, and the howls of delight define the Bonemaster's work.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The gleaming carriages of the Nehekharan chariots shine with the power of the brassworker's mastery.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) What better ammunition for catapults than the flaming, screaming skulls of the defeated dead?
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The Tomb Kings' citadels dominate the landscape of the desert, fixed and imposing amongst the ever-shifting sands.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Interred in resplendent and decadent tombs, Nehekharan royalty lie in repose until their kingdom calls them hence.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) From the death houses of Nehekhara, the dead continue to rise to fulfil their as-yet unfinished duty.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Those of noble blood are interred in the royal catacombs, awakening to pursue their living aspirations once more.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Glittering chambers of worked and preserved bone provide the perfect sanctuary for the resting dead.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Gaze upon the face of Tomb Kings past - the Hierotitan is the likeness of Nehekhara's sovereigns made massive.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) In the once-resplendent streets of the Nehekharan cities, the dead shuffle about their business as if nothing has changed.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Death is more than a business now, it is life itself!
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Great edifices flank the streets of the great Nehekharan cities; monuments to those who came before.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Those consigned to another world, revived to an insipid parody of life to do their master's bidding.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) Interred at their liege lord's request, these soldiers are ready to fight again at a moment's notice.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The Tomb Kings demanded loyalty from their soldiers until death and beyond. In Unlife, they expect the same.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The abominable Necrosphinx towers above the Nehekharans, offering protection and destruction in exchange for hushed and cowed adoration.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) It is not the sting of the Scorpion that kills, but rather its powerful claws and voracious, insatiable appetite.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The City of Kings is an eternal monument to the sovereigns of the desert.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) May the God of the Skies bless the warriors that stride forth in his name.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The heat-bleached bone warriors of grim countenance watch over the battlements, watching for foes through hollowed sockets.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) These lithified walls have seen empires rise and fall, and endured the accession of doom. They hold.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The hieroglyphics inscribed upon these battlements channel protective wards, fending off any would-be invaders.
[PH] (TK Description Edit if needs be) The might of the Khemrian Warsphinx stands astride the cities of the dead, roaring eternally.
Gem mines are valuable resources, especially if they have a high yield.
Precious gems are said to capture the eyes, minds and hearts of the living, so maybe their souls too.
The opulence of the unliving knows no bounds and requires magnificent stones to be unearthed in ever-increasing amounts...
Volcanic ore is quite rare, and a precious resource for Nagash due to the way it can interact with certain magic lores.
Items, such as talismans, made from obsidian often hold arcane power, it is this reason that Nagash uses it to build his strongholds.
To be skilled at carving obsidian is to be skilled in sigils and symbols of power, for obsidian soaks in the ensorcelled.
Deep in the red pits can be found mercury in the raw form of cinnabar. A material often used in Dark Magic rituals.
The Blood Mines are red as cinnabar - and occasionally Warpstone - are found here in significant seams.
Best not choose the dark green powder, though, it certainly isn't snuff!
To hunt here is to become the hunted, for the prey is vicious and probably dead already…
Should the dead be commanded to, an expedition will venture into the haunted woods in search of beasts to be killed, then promptly unkilled.d]
What is the Flayer? A myth, but one that is all too real.
Gold found here is always tarnished and far from the pure element so beloved by Dwarfs. Nevertheless, it has value.
When the Legions of Nagash discover a large seam of gold, they will send their minions forth to scour it clean.
A great furnace with an ornate, brazen face, and yellow-green balefire within its sneering mouth.
The blackest iron ore can be found in the deepest pits, underneath the mountains upon which gothic castles perch.
Since before the building of Nagashizzar, Necromancers have used Zombies & Ghouls to burrow and mine mountains for their minerals.
Cursed iron ore is laced with Warpstone. Such mines are prized.
The dread castles of the Legions of Nagash are made from stone shaped by the dead themselves.
There is an art to creating a memorable tombstone or grand mausoleum.
Some gargoyles are fashioned by sculptors - others just appear, as if they flew there themselves.
Beneath the blood-clotted streams and rank sewage are pits of dense, dark clay.
Using the raw clay compound, urn makers create opulent vessels to carry the ashes of powerful beings.
Perhaps there is some spirit trapped within, burning in abject agony every time the kilns are lit?
Stagnant ponds can be found by their disgusting reek, the brackish water full of brine and other things…
The only thing that rises from these crumbling salt marshes are bony hands reaching toward the sky.
Deep in the dead marches are salt pans, containing piles and piles of bones, bleached and scoured white.
Foresting in Hunger Wood or the Spider Haunts is surely a fool's job?
Once part of a burgeoning timber industry, the sawmills have remained in a ruined, yet operational state since...
From the ruined sawmills, Zombie bearers transport their cursed loads to large sheds long-thought abandoned by mortals.
When a Vampire drinks an "aged red" from a wine glass, chances are it hasn't been made from grapes…
These orchards contain low-hanging, spooky trees, whose thorny branches are as likely to grab a passer-by as provide fruit.
Vampires crave the illusion that they are nobles, and so they bottle their own "special" vintages.
